I think it’s too much to return to my past, to try to reconnect and become an athlete again.
But I shouldn’t let my past hinder my future opportunities.
Coming to terms with the past will be easier if I make a future without fear of failing again.
People like yourself and Moxie are helping me each step of the way.
I always thought I might be better at coaching than actually racing.
I don’t know, I just thought I had a good coaching mentality.
I think you’ve convinced me to reach out to some of my old friends again.
Thank you [playername].
If I can love myself, I can forgive myself for failing.
It’s easier said than done, but I know what you mean, I just never imagined that I had these kinds of problems.
I’d always see it in my friends, and try to help them, but me? I just overlooked myself.
Never thought I deserved that treatment.
You’ve made me realize that I was wrong, thank you [playername].
I certainly noticed you came out of your shell a lot in the days we’ve spent together. I’m hoping to see you become the best person you can possibly be in the future.
She stands up and stretches. And as she’s doing so, the entire location morphs into a bar full of chatter and buzz. There’s even a table full of familiar faces, our mutual friends.
From the day I met you [playername], I always knew there was something quite special about you.
I don’t cry for nothing, but I’ll shed a tear for this.
With the nightmare vanquished, Riku wanders to the table of friends and my vision returns to black.
Selene is at my side again with a smile from cheek to cheek.
That was adorable, I’m glad I brought you along [playername].
Just trying to help in any way I can.
Any luck finding the culprit?
No luck right now, we’re going to check Ruby’s nightmare next.
A sea of stars overwhelms and with a glow of ethereal light we’re suddenly on a balcony high up on a castle tower in Arcadia.
The view of the surrounding mountains, city and suburbs is beautiful, yet vague.
It’s as if it’s not a fully formed thought, perhaps what someone would imagine the view looks like without ever having seen it.
Inside from the balcony is a bedroom, where Ruby is in front of a beautiful mannequin as she threads a dress on it.
This doesn’t seem like a nightmare…
Nightmares aren’t black and white; they may reveal themselves in subtle ways. Sometimes so subtle you can’t even tell.
Selene’s words pique my curiosity, so I closely watch the situation through the window.
Ruby turns around and goes to a desk drawer to get a few things, and something unnerving and far from subtle happens, leaving both me and Selene mouths agape.
With instantaneous movement, the mannequin had followed Ruby, and was now right behind her.
When Ruby turns around, this causes her to jump with fright.
Should I step in?
If you have a plan, you’re at your own discretion.
I look back to Ruby who curiously inspects the mannequin from every angle.
As she does so, the other mannequins in the room close in one by one, and before Ruby has even realized it, she’s surrounded by these humanoid figures.
The sudden realisation of this causes her to panic and kneel down in the fetal position.
G-Go away! Stop!
I can’t watch this farce any longer, I open the balcony door and step inside. Ruby doesn’t even react to my presence, not yet anyway.
I get closer and reach my hand out to Ruby, she takes it and hugs me tightly.
Oh thank goodness it’s you darling!
This is so scary, these ghastly mannequins just started moving on their own, you have to protect me!
Why is she having a nightmare like this?
Too stressed? No darling, I love my work.
It’s just these spooky mannequins started moving on their own!
Representations? Judges?
Are they here to judge me? Goodness, but I have sinned so much!
Hmm… I don’t think this nightmare is half as nuanced as Riku’s.
Wait, are you scared of ghosts?
Ohhoh, terrified darling! I hate them!
She embraces me closer, nuzzling her face into my shoulder, this causes the mannequins to instantly pop to face us, causing me to jump momentarily.
I must admit, this is somewhat creepy.
*Sniffles* It-It’s just like this scary movie I saw as a young filly, *sob*, I hated that movie so much!
I had nightmares for months! Nay, years!
This nightmare is entirely different to Riku’s, so my strategy to soothe her should be different.
B-But they are real! They’re here to get me!
I always put salt down at my doorstep to protect my house from ghosts, but I forgot when I moved into my new palace! Eeee!
B-but they’re moving!
Yeah sure, I can move and I’m not scary.
It’s so unnatural darling, it gives me the shakes.
That didn’t work. I’ll try to show her just how easy it is to fight this particular fear.
Look, these are just plastic mannequins. They can teleport behind you all day, but they can’t do anything to you.
I push one over to prove a point and it falls to the floor with a clunk with Ruby watching wide-eyed.
Suddenly it transforms into a robed figure, causing Ruby to freak out even more than before!
Kyaaahhhh, it’s a ghost! Oh my gosh, oh my gosh, kill it!
Wait, no! It’s a person, it’s just some stupid unicorn using magic to prank you!
Come on, let’s get them?
P-Prank? It’s just magic?
W-Wait… Ghosty stuff is just magic?
The robed figure awkwardly clambers up to their feet and starts to run away through the bedroom door. Who the heck was that? What a strange dream.
Selene suddenly runs past me.
That’s the culprit! Chase them [playername]!
P-PRINCESS? T-This is too much! Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
At the moment of her screaming, the entire world suddenly vanishes, leaving me and Selene in a void again.
Awwhhh… I blew it.
What happened?
Ruby just woke up, the nightmare got too extreme for her.
Woops, does this mean her nightmare is over?
For now, I guess. I'll definitely be able to end it when I figure out what the source of the nightmares is.
Let’s go, let’s go, my heart is racing. Let’s put this adrenaline to beneficial use.
That's the attitude! Let’s check the closest sleeping person then, Moxie!
Moxie’s dream? This should be good.
I bet she’s dreaming about me because we didn’t have sex tonight, could be awkward!
The world reforms in a burst of light around us, and it’s a dream of…
A dream of her doing a performance, Selene and myself have a view from the audience where we sit among others on long wooden seats.
I am the great and powerful Moxie, and today I will show you something truly magnificent!
I haven’t had an opportunity to watch one of these before, although this is a nightmare, so it may be the worst-case scenario.
Maybe she has a fear of messing up on stage.
It’ll be interesting to see what type of nightmares a potential future student of mine has.
Moxie seems so unwavering in spite of her insecurities; I can’t imagine what’ll happen.
As I say that, the curtain is lifted, and a strange sight leaves both myself and Selene rather surprised indeed.
There’s an iron cage, and inside that is a ferocious bear-like creature.
And with that, it all falls into place, she’s reliving the worst day of her life.
I thought she was over this; I didn’t get the impression that it was something that haunted her to this day.
Nightmares don’t necessarily align to what haunts you.
I’m aware of the situation that may unfold before us, and I also have faith that Moxie has moved past this. But nightmares often manifest using the moments that matter to us most.
Right, we know how this situation has played in reality, but… this nightmare could be far worse.
As the caged creature crashes around, it wows the audience, but clearly worries Moxie. Selene quietly watches the situation unfold.
You’re right… Lily said the ursa was a ‘child’, but that’s a fully grown ursa. This could be the worst-case scenario.
I’m going to try my best to contain the ursa and keep Moxie asleep, I need you to search and identify the culprit, I know they’ll be nearby.
She rises and makes strides towards the stage as the creature finally breaks its restraints and charges out.
Just as it’s about to attack Moxie, and potentially wake her up, Selene channels a paralysis spell that holds the bear in place! Moxie manages to quickly scurry away, that should buy us some time.
The audience erupts into chaos and begins to escape from the scene in every direction possible.
Within that chaos I looked around everywhere for that robed figure I saw earlier.
In my search, I peer around the back of the stage and find Moxie. She's clearly distressed.
Moxie, you have to get out of here, it’s dangerous!
[playername]…? What are you doing here?
She runs up to me and tightly embraces me. Her softness sends a shiver of butterflies through my gut.
She feels so real! Sigh… Moxie…
You’re here to save me again…
What do you mean?
She nuzzles her cheek into my face, not letting go for a second.
The unexpected reunion was nice. But the chaos, the bear and the adrenaline running through my body is preventing me from calming down right now.
Fortunately, I see a relieving sight, Selene behind Moxie with a smile on her face.
Ah, the nightmare had dissipated during the hug. The bear vanished, along with the chaotic crowd.
Mmphh, whenever I need you most, you’re always there for me.
When you came into my life, you made everything so much better.
I don’t know what I’d do without you.
You really love me, don’t you?
More than you could ever know.
Moxie pulls away and turns to see Selene behind us.
What’s going on? I’m… I’m confused… Why are you here Selene? I-I'm dreaming aren't I!
Ooohh, she's sharp! Perfect for a future student of mine.
We’re here strictly on business, Moxie. Do you want to do the honours, [playername]?
We’re looking for a robed figure, have you seen anyone?
Robed… Yeah, actually. Behind the stage, there was someone wearing a long cloak.
Thank you Moxie, I’ll see you later, okay?
Stay safe!
She kisses me on the cheek before Selene and I dash to the stage.
A robed figure is indeed hidden behind the dark wood of the stage, their face enshrouded by darkness casting an imposing figure.
Identify yourself!
Haphazardly the figure leaps away from us, and I give pursuit.
Wait!
As I’m chasing, they trip on the fabric of their long robe while attempting to cast a bizarre incantation. But it works in their favour as they conjure a portal and falls straight into it.
Unfortunately, this floor-bound portal engulfs me too, before immediately closing, separating Selene and I in two separate dreams.
When I come to, I’m in a fairly familiar location. But it takes me a few moments to re-adjust.
Where is the person I was just chasing? Damnit, why didn’t I appear adjacent to them.
I'm all alone now... Am I in danger? I hope not.
I realize where I am, I’m in the corridor of the tree library, in-between Penelope and Lily’s rooms.
Whose dream is this, though?
My doubts were soon affirmed by the moaning coming from Penelope’s rooms, specifically the moans of Moxie. That means it’s probably Penny’s dream.
I peek through the gap in the door and I spot Moxie and Penelope having sex on Penelope’s bed.
It’s strange seeing Moxie again immediately in a different context.
No less having sex with another…
I know that it’s not really Moxie, but… I probably shouldn't watch this.
This is like a nightmare for me, not for her.
To be jealous of Moxie sleeping with others is a dangerous precedent considering I’m freely sleeping around. I feel like a complete hypocrite right now.
Is this how Moxie feels when I sleep around? An uncomfortable feeling in the gut, it’s not pleasant.
Either I talk to Moxie about my feelings, or I shut up.
Distracted with my own thought, I hadn’t even noticed that Moxie had completely disappeared from the room.
Upon reinspection, Penelope is sat there alone, she looks exhausted.
Politely knocking on the door, I step inside.
Hey Penny.
She turns to me, her expression unchanging.
Ah, it’s you. Moxie’s new lover.
She sounds unusually bitter. Actually, she’s wholly rougher around the edges than her usual persona.
Is that so? Or is this just another one of your ploys.
My ploys? No, I’m serious.
Where’s Moxie?
What do you mean? I saw her a few seconds ago right here.
She vanished when you arrived, I haven’t seen her since.
Yeah, but…
She doesn’t visit me anymore; she used to always come and visit me in the evenings.
I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to push her away from you.
I remember when I gave her that book, we spent an evening laughing, and casting magic together.
Ending with love, affection and snuggling in my bed.
Then two days later, she shows up to my doorstep with the absolute accident that is you.
I was wondering what the nightmare was for a while, since this started as a wet dream.
Nightmares don’t usually involve sex and love, but it seems like her nightmare was being abandoned and lonely.
And now I’m here. I just added a confrontational element, as such, I have become her nightmare.
Penny, I know you had a crush on Moxie, but you have to realize she never felt the same way, it was always platonic for her.
Was it though? We were so close, if you didn’t exist maybe we would still be together!
You don’t understand, Moxie was going through a lot.
Since you clearly know so much about us in the short time you’ve been here, do enlighten me.
You told me that she felt extremely lonely, and was likely using you for comfort and intimacy, especially during the beginning of her heat.
Hmph… Well yeah…
She had a hole within herself that needed to be filled, and you filled that far better than I ever could. No innuendos intended.
It’s okay to be jealous, but you can’t let those feelings control and blind you.
Oh bother, we’ve already discussed this before, haven’t we?
I believe so, yeah, you know Moxie didn’t want to date you.
It really feels like Moxie’s misery and loneliness transferred to me instead.
Moxie thought she was relying on me, but in truth…
I was relying on her, perhaps even more.
It’s unfair to put that burden on a singular person, and it’s unfair to have those expectations of someone.
Especially when they may not even reciprocate your feelings.
But we had so many great times together. I don’t understand why she always distanced herself from me... Mixed signals always confused me.
How was I supposed to know how she felt? I can’t read minds.
It’s not her mind you need to worry about, it’s yours
Penelope’s ears perk up, she’s listening.
You’re letting your emotions get ahead of you and control yourself. For a moment I want you to try to consider your emotions from an outside perspective.
My emotions are who I am, even if I try to be objective that doesn’t change that.
On the contrary, your emotions are a reaction to events. It’s definitely possible to control your reaction.
When you see a glass of water, it can be half empty, or half full depending on whether you’re a pessimist or an optimist.
I’m not following.
Ask yourself honestly, was Moxie’s happiness your primary goal?
Umm… Of course! I worked hard to make her feel better after everything she’s been through; I was always there for her. I tried my best to please her during sex, I let her borrow books.
Despite that, Moxie has found someone else, and is now happier. If that’s what you really want, why aren’t you happy?
Because… Now I’m the lonely one…
I wait patiently, keeping eye contact with the teary-eyed mare. It’s not cold, but she’s shivering.
I get it…
She takes a tissue from a nearby drawer and dries her tears.
I was doing all these things for Moxie, not out of the kindness of my heart, but because I wanted love and intimacy in return.
That in itself was inherently selfish, but I was too stuck in my delusions of ‘helping’ and being a ‘good friend’.
If I was really a good friend, I’d be happy for her, like you said.
And why are you sad? If she never loved you in the first place, why are you sad now that she’s distanced herself from you?
Hah, shit, saying it out loud makes me sound awful. I think I’m sad because I expected love and intimacy in return for everything I did.
But, of course I don’t deserve that...
In fact, I don’t even think I deserve to be sad over this, I feel ridiculous crying.
Self-awareness is the most crucial step to solving the problem.
Can you tell me what you need to do next to completely solve this problem? You already told me once.
Yup, I did... I put far too much pressure on Moxie, when there are so many beautiful and amazing people out there in the world that may actually reciprocate my love.
Exactly, and you’re still friends with Moxie.
Yeah, I think it’s time I got over myself.
Penelope seems a lot more awake and lively now, colour returning to the world as she yawns and stretches out.
Thanks for this, [playername]. I was stuck in a strange place, and I didn’t have the id to realize it.
It’s fine, I’m partly responsible for this anyway.
You did nothing wrong, don’t worry about it.
I suppose with a clear mind, the only thing I lost is sex. I think I’ll make a visit to the brothel tonight for some much-needed relief.
Unless you want to try the gender-changing spell again? Heheh.
I’d love to, but I’m afraid I have something important to do.
Oh? What’s that?
Uhm, well… Can you create a portal to someone else’s dream?
Haha, that’s impossible! Unless you’re Princess Selene, unicorns can only do that if they’re already in the dream realm.
Yes, that’s perfect, could you make a portal to say… Honeycrisp, Butters or Lily’s dream?
Wha? But we’re not…
Well, I can try to humour you, but I doubt it’ll work.
She stands up and nonchalantly zaps the corner of the room, expecting nothing.
To her shock, but not mine, a portal does indeed form.
Thank you so much Penelope.
What the heck? I’m dreaming?
Yep! Thank you, I gotta go before you wake up! Have a good sleep!
Wait, you have some explaining to do!
You won’t remember this anyway!
I take my leave and slip into the portal. Hopefully, Selene is on this side.
This side of the portal is complete darkness.
Judging by that and the ambient sounds I’m outside.
It takes my eyes a few seconds to adjust, but as I look above I can see the stars and moon.
Gradually the light of the moon illuminates the surroundings enough for me to realize that I'm on a field.
I think I'm standing in the middle of one of Honeycrisp’s farm fields.
It’s raining too, and I’m genuinely getting wet.
I walk through the soggy fields towards the farmhouse, each step is moist and unpleasant.
When I reach the farmhouse and walk around it, all the windows are inexplicably barricaded, and the front door is locked.
Seems like I’m alone out here. Dark, wet and cold.
At least there’s an overhang on the door preventing the rain from dropping on me.
The farm looks abandoned, perhaps this is Honeycrisp’s fear of failure taken to its extreme.
I wish Selene was here, this situation is starting to get stressful.
Honeycrisp must be around somewhere, there’s no dream without an occupant.
I close my eyes and try to listen as hard as I can through the constant pitter-patter of the the rain.
There’s faint conversation near me, I had suspected as much. Someone’s in this boarded up farmhouse.
I knock on the door, pounding rather loudly on the wooden boards.
There’s no response, but there is a small scuffle on the inside.
Well I’ll be… It’s [playername]! Let him in, quick!
Well I'll be... It's a male survivor! Let him in, quick!
The door is gently opened a quarter of the way and I shimmy through the gap as it’s quickly shut and shackled behind me by a flustered orange mare.
The door is gently opened a quarter of the way and I shimmy through the gap as it’s quickly shut and shackled behind me by a flustered Blossom.
A wary yellow mare walks up towards me, and she’s holding a menacing looking shotgun.
This is Honeycrisp, right? This must be her nightmare.
A wary Honeycrisp walks up towards me, and she’s holding a menacing looking shotgun too.
What the hell is going on?
A man! You must be one of the tough ones if you managed to escape those walkers, let alone the chaos in Arcadia...
Glad you’re not another one of those walkers stud, I knew you’d be one of the tough ones that managed to escape the chaos in Arcadia.
What are you talking about?
Heh, y’all could have run anywhere, but ya came straight to the farm.
Probably thinkin’ that me and Blossom would be out here kickin’ ass. I must admit, I’m flattered.
Yeah! Super awesome that you stumbled your way in here, I was worried those zombie numbskulls would have gotten all the men.
Yeah! Super awesome that you’re here, I was worried those zombie numbskulls would have gotten to you too.
Zombies… A zombie apocalypse, out there?
I peek through a gap in the wooden barricade into the dark night, and I do indeed see swathes of stumbling pony zombies steadily shambling and shaking.
Those were out there with me? This nightmare is even more dangerous than Moxie’s!
But… I’m pretty sure I didn’t see any zombies outside… They must have just been manifested by Honeycrisp.
It was chaos, one of those Goddesses turned evil, before anyone knew it, all unicorns turned into zombie-like slaves and started to eat the brains of others.
Ugh, why is this her nightmare? I suppose it makes sense if Honey is a god-fearing pony, but how am I supposed to resolve such a ridiculous nightmare?
Selene would be a perfect fit to fix this nightmare.
Gosh, Sis, some of them are coming this way!
Argh damnit, maybe they heard us open the door.
Sorry, I might have led them here.
Not your fault stud.
I’d probably go insane in a zombie apocalypse without some good dick, so you were worth the risk.
Sis, that’s too vulgar!
Different world, different rules, Blossom, we’re gonna stake it out in this zombie apocalypse and we’ll have to share the man.
This may be a nightmare for her, but it's starting to sound like a dream to me.
Different world, different rules, Blossom, we’re gonna stake it out in this zombie apocalypse and we’ll have to share [playername].
Jesus Christ, did she really just say that?
Honey cocks her shotgun and squints through the boards.
Blossom sidles up next to me and goes to whisper something into my ear...
Although…
No words come out, complete silence. It’s eerie.
Pardon? I’m not hearing you, Blossom.
Is she a zombie?!
Uhm… Blossom?
It’s because she’s not the real Blossom, only a subject of the dreamer, hence she can only have real interactions with the dreamer.
Selene! Finally!
Selene leans smugly at the door before graciously moving towards me and patting me on the head.
You gave me quite the fright mister. When I yelled ‘wait’, I was talking to you!
Goodness Selene, I’m so glad you’re here, I already sorted out Penelope’s nightmare, but this one is impossible!
And I believe I soothed the nightmare of Lily while trying to find you.
To think I was a few meters off from Penelope and finding you. I’m so sorry young one, I’ll make it up to you when this is all over.
Wot in tarnation is this! It’s the evil goddess!
Ohoh, evil? No, my dear, there is no evil goddess.
Well if there is no evil goddess, then how do you explain all those zombies out there?
Those look like zombies to you? That’s a rude thing to call your customers.
C-Custom... What kinda hijinx is this?
I’m serious, look outside, they’re just drunk ponies looking to buy cider.
If this is one of your evil tricks, I-I’ll...
As Honey peers outside. Fascinatingly, the zombies are indeed friendly drunks that want to buy cider.
Well I’ll be, customers! Blossom go get a barrel of the good stuff; we got some selling to do.
With that succinctly sorted, Selene takes me to the side to talk to me privately.
How did you do that? That was incredible, you’re a life saver!
Hehe, you learn a few tricks in your time, especially effective on highly impressionable dreamers.
Dreams are malleable, all you need to do is plant the seed in someone’s mind and they’ll do the heavy lifting.
Ah ha ha! I’d call you a genius, but I’d feel strange to flatter a goddess.
The sweet nectar of compliments keeps a hag like me going.
When you called me a genius, I still felt a tinge of happiness deep inside.
And here was me trying to be subtle and understated with my compliments in an attempt to seem formal.
Bless you, you don’t need to be formal with me, that’s how you behave around my sister.
With me, you let loose, I’m the ‘cool’ royal sister, hehe.
Or if you get to know me really well, I'm the 'after dark' royal sister, hehehe.
You two are goddesses, right? I don’t understand your powers, but it feels like you could have done this all by yourself.
Ahh, a goddess I may be, but I have a soft spot for these girls.
I wanted to bring you along to end their nightmares, even if we caught the culprit the nightmares would have persisted.
I’m sorry if that seems pushy, but I feel like you’re hiding something... I think you could have ended all these nightmares by yourself. If you’re the cool sister, you don’t mind if I pry, do you?
Hehehe, you’re too intelligent for your own good.
You know [playername], it’s rather refreshing to have someone talk to me like I’m an equal.
I only get that playful attitude from my sister, everyone else seems terrified and guarded around me.
That’s the impression I got, you have no frame of reference when everyone is new and strange to you.
Ahaha, I’ll put you on my list little boy.
I think it’s time to show you my ulterior motive, it’s time to visit the last nightmare.
With a snap of the fingers the surroundings turn black before dissipating in a wave of smoke leaving us in…
Butters’s cottage. What does Butters have to do with Selene’s motive?
Ah- you’re…
Uuu, you two are persistent.
You don’t need to run anymore. It’s okay, Butters.
The robed figure who is quaking in place, finally drops the robes from her body, revealing the innocent(?) Butters.
Um, I’m sorry, I tried my best...
So you were the culprit? I suppose that makes sense, but why?
It wasn’t my fault; I couldn’t stop it.
I knew it. The relic I gave you, it’s emanating dark energy.
The relic that captures unicorn dust?
Hah, I don’t know how you do it [playername], but you have a way to make people tell you anything.
You know that was supposed to be a secret, Butters.
Wait, you two know each other?
Mmhm…
Butters and I were acquainted once, I often deal with problems of the magical variety within society, and therefore her succubuification was under my jurisdiction.
I unfortunately didn’t have a cure, but I helped Butters as much as I could and gave her this relic.
What’s so special about this relic?
It absorbs the energy from sleeping ponies, specifically their dreams. When used on unicorns, it can collect a small amount of unicorn dust.
Ahah, and this thing has been causing nightmares…
Oh, by the way Butters, congratulations on finally curing your curse.
Thank you Miss, [playername] helped me lots.
Oh no, no, I was just a lackey that helped you fetch some ingredients, and it’s debatable whether I helped at all. It’s just a coincidence that I was there, the curing was all you Butters.
I’ll congratulate you too on the peak of years of work, I don’t think I fully appreciated how much you fought for that at the time.
Oh gosh, thank you two so much. I don’t know what to say, it’s overwhelming being congratulated by the Princess.
Oh, but, the nightmares! I think that’s my fault!
Well you see, I’ve been debating the source of the nightmares all night, it’s either the relic, or it’s [playername].
Surely it’s just the relic, right?
Yeah, it may seem fairly conclusive based on all the evidence, but I need to comb over every detail to ensure the problem is fully uprooted.
I mentioned this earlier, but these nightmares have only been occurring among your friends, but specifically, not you.
Ahh, is there something wrong with me?
I’m not sure, I feel like I can be honest with you, but I brought you along so I could pay attention to you and how you interacted with the magical energies.
Ah, so that was your ulterior motive. That’s not as exciting as I expected, but it’s understandable.
I guess I wanted to spend some time with you too, if that helps sate your craving for excitement.
What about me Miss? I also see those people semi-frequently.
Selene takes an unusually long time to reply, but she appears to be deep in thought causing both Butters and I to hang in anticipation for her next word.
I’ve deduced that the anti-evil potion you created isn't making the negative energy dissipate, it's just releasing it into the wind.
Causing a constant release of negative energy that the relic has collected, and also directly afflicting the people you spend the most time with.
It's a double threat, in other words you’re sending bad vibes to your friends in person and in dreams.
It doesn't seem to have had any effect on [playername] because he's recently been in contact with a Dewblossom.
Oh no, I thought I was finally free, but I’m still a freak…
Don’t worry, hehe. Now that I’ve finally figured it out, and tracked you down, I’m here to remedy the issue.
I’ll just absorb the excess bad energy for you, so there will be no further adverse effects.
